author: @kwtx
title: Sister of woman charged with stabbing boyfriend 52 times returned to McLennan County
text: Sister of woman charged with stabbing boyfriend 52 times returned to McLennan County WACO, Texas (KWTX) - The sister of an Oklahoma woman charged with stabbing and slashing her estranged boyfriend 52 times in April 2023 was returned to McLennan County Wednesday, charged as an accomplice in the murder. Joann Arey Cometsevah, 34, remains in the McLennan County Jail under $1 million bond in the death of her sisterâ€™s estranged boyfriend, 44-year-old David Ralph Peeler. Cometsevah is charged with murder and tampering with evidence in Peelerâ€™s death. Her sister, Leah Cecelia Breuer, 37, also is charged with murder and remains jailed under $500,000 bond. Breuer attempted to have her bond reduced at a hearing last week. However, 54th State District Judge Susan Kelly denied her request after determining she is a danger to society and a flight risk. Cometsevah was arrested last week in California on the McLennan County warrant. Peelerâ€™s brother-in-law discovered his body on a deflated air mattress at the Village Square Apartments, 3500 Meyers Lane. He suffered multiple stab wounds to his torso, police said at the time. At Breuerâ€™s hearing last week, Assistant District Attorney Ralph Strother argued against the bond reduction, telling the judge that Peeler was stabbed and slashed 52 times and declined to prosecute Breuer in a previous assault because he had feelings for her. He said the sisters are linked to the murder and authorities believe they put the murder weapon or weapons and other evidence in a dumpster at the Kate Ross Apartments. According to the tampering with physical evidence arrest affidavit against Cometsevah, Breuer told investigators in a taped interview that her sister took a knife from the scene. â€œAt a later date, detectives spoke with a jail informant that was housed with Leah at the McLennan County Jail,â€ the affidavit states. â€œThe jail informant advised that Leah also told said jail informant that the defendant (Cometsevah) had Leah assist the defendant in gathering the weapon by removing it from his neck, the victimâ€™s phone and blood-soaked items from the scene and threw them in a garbage dumpster located near the Kate Ross Apartments, 937 S. 11th St.â€ An Uber driver who drove the sisters from the scene confirmed that she was asked to drop the sisters near the front of the apartment complex, according to the affidavit. Copyright 2024 KWTX. All rights reserved.

author: Ny Ando A.
title: Android 15 enfin dispo ! Quelles sont les nouveautÃ©s, comment lâ€™installer ?
text:
AprÃ¨s de longs mois dâ€™attente, Android 15 est enfin lÃ  ! Google a annoncÃ©, le 15 octobre, le dÃ©ploiement de la derniÃ¨re mise Ã  jour de son systÃ¨me dâ€™exploitation.
En effet, Google a dÃ©voilÃ© Android 15 le mercredi 15 octobre. DÃ©couvrez dans cet article les nouvelles fonctionnalitÃ©s proposÃ©es, les smartphones compatibles et ce quâ€™il faut faire pour installer la MAJ.
Quelles surprises Google nous a-t-il rÃ©servÃ©es avec Android 15 ?
Google a dÃ©cidÃ© de frapper fort avec Android 15. Lâ€™une des grandes nouveautÃ©s est lâ€™utilisation de lâ€™intelligence artificielle pour lutter contre le vol de smartphones. DÃ©sormais, en cas de vol Ã  lâ€™arrachÃ©e, le tÃ©lÃ©phone se verrouille automatiquement, rendant lâ€™appareil inutilisable.
Ce verrouillage instantanÃ© est activÃ© dÃ¨s que lâ€™appareil dÃ©tecte des mouvements suspects. Si cela ne suffit pas, vous pouvez verrouiller votre tÃ©lÃ©phone Ã  distance en utilisant votre numÃ©ro.
Et pour encore plus de sÃ©curitÃ©, Android 15 complique lâ€™accÃ¨s aux paramÃ¨tres sensibles. Toute tentative de rÃ©initialisation du smartphone nÃ©cessite un code PIN ou une authentification biomÃ©trique.
AprÃ¨s plusieurs codes erronÃ©s, le tÃ©lÃ©phone se bloquera automatiquement, devenant inutilisable et difficilement revendable. Je trouve que cette fonctionnalitÃ© est pratique pour dÃ©courager les voleurs tout en protÃ©geant vos donnÃ©es.
Google a aussi introduit une fonctionnalitÃ© appelÃ©e Espace privÃ© qui agit comme un vÃ©ritable coffre-fort numÃ©rique. Ce dernier stocke vos applications sensibles comme celles liÃ©es aux rÃ©seaux sociaux, rencontres ou bancaires.
Cet espace privÃ© peut Ãªtre verrouillÃ© et mÃªme complÃ¨tement masquÃ© de lâ€™Ã©cran dâ€™accueil, garantissant une discrÃ©tion totale. Ce nouvel outil offre ainsi un niveau de confidentialitÃ© encore jamais vu sur Android.
Quoi dâ€™autres ?
Avec Android 15, Google a portÃ© une attention particuliÃ¨re aux utilisateurs de smartphones pliables. DÃ©sormais, il est possible, tant sur les smartphones pliables que sur les tablettes, de fixer et de dÃ©tacher la barre des tÃ¢ches Ã  lâ€™Ã©cran.
Cette nouveautÃ©, pratique et simple, amÃ©liore considÃ©rablement lâ€™expÃ©rience multitÃ¢che en offrant la possibilitÃ© de personnaliser lâ€™Ã©cran dâ€™accueil et de sÃ©lectionner ses applications favorites.
Mais ce nâ€™est pas tout ! Android 15 amÃ©liore aussi la qualitÃ© des photos prises dans des conditions de faible luminositÃ©. GrÃ¢ce Ã  lâ€™option â€œBoost en basse lumiÃ¨reâ€, vos clichÃ©s seront plus nets mÃªme dans lâ€™obscuritÃ©.
Google propose Ã©galement une nouveautÃ© que jâ€™estime aussi plutÃ´t intÃ©ressante : la messagerie par satellite. DÃ©sormais, les applications des opÃ©rateurs utilisent les rÃ©seaux satellitaires pour acheminer vos messages.
Cela signifie que vous pouvez envoyer et recevoir des messages oÃ¹ que vous soyez. Et ce, mÃªme dans une zone sans rÃ©seau mobile (2G, 3G, 4G, 5G) ou sans Wi-Fi.
Android 15 : quels smartphones sont compatibles ?
Comme Ã  lâ€™accoutumÃ©e, Google privilÃ©gie ses propres produits pour les premiÃ¨res mises Ã  jour. Les rÃ©cents smartphones de la gamme Pixel peuvent dorÃ©navant accueillir Android 15.
Parmi ces smartphones figurent :
- Google Pixel 6, 6 Pro, 6a, 7, 7 Pro, 7a,
- Google Pixel Tablet
- Google Pixel Fold
- Google Pixel 8, 8 Pro
Google Pixel 9, 9 Pro, 9 Pro XL, 9 Pro Fold
Les constructeurs tels que Samsung, Xiaomi et OnePlus devraient suivre sous peu, en dÃ©ployant la mise Ã  jour sur leurs modÃ¨les phares. Patience donc pour les utilisateurs de ces marques, car lâ€™attente ne devrait plus Ãªtre trÃ¨s longue.
Si vous possÃ©dez un Google Pixel compatible, lâ€™installation dâ€™Android 15 se fait en quelques Ã©tapes simples :
- Rendez-vous dans les ParamÃ¨tres de votre appareil.
- SÃ©lectionnez lâ€™option SystÃ¨me.
- Cliquez sur Mises Ã  jour logicielles.
- Appuyez sur Mise Ã  jour (du) systÃ¨me pour lancer le processus.
Et voilÃ , vous Ãªtes prÃªt Ã  explorer les nouveautÃ©s dâ€™Android 15 sur votre appareil !

author: Scott Bregman
title: Olympic silver medallist Kagiyama Yuma tops short program at Torino 2025 World University Winter Games
text:
Two-time Olympic figure skating silver medallist Kagiyama Yuma earned the highest score in the menâ€™s short program Thursday (16 January) at the Torino 2025 World University Winter Games.
The Japanese skater managd a season's best of 106.82, ahead of compatriot Sato Shun (96.30) and Italy's Daniel Grassl (93.82).
Kagiyama opened his program, set to The Sound of Silence, with a clean quadruple toe loop, triple toe loop combination. He followed it up with a quadruple Salchow that moved seamlessly into his sit spin.
His final jumping pass was a triple Axel, to the delight of coach and Olympic bronze medallist Carolina Kostner, who jumped for joy behind the boards.
The 2024-25 season has started strong for Kagiyama, 21, who won both of his Grand Prix assignments and finished runner-up at the Grand Prix Final to world champion Ilia Malinin of the United States.
He recently claimed his first-ever Japanese national title, a championship once held by his father. At the Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022, Kagiyama won silver medals in both the individual and team events.
Sato, 20, was last to skate Thursday and one of the few with the resume coming into the event to challenge Kagiyama for the top spot, having clinched the Cup of China Grand Prix earlier in the season. He delivered a clean program, jumping a quad toe, triple toe combination to open, followed by a quad Flip and a triple Axel, but came up short.
It was a much needed turn-around for Sato who finished a disappointing seventh at the recent Japanese nationals.
For 2022 European silver medallist Grassl, it was a season best score powered, in part, by a quadruple Lutz opening jump.
The menâ€™s free skate at the World University Winter Games is set for Saturday (18 January).
A winter wonder in Italy awaits! ðŸ‚â„ï¸ðŸŽ¿ Ticket-inclusive hospitality packages for the Olympic Winter Games in Italy go live on 6th February 2025! ðŸŽ« Don't miss your chance to secure Milano Cortina 2026 tickets to the most sought-after sporting sessions paired with luxury service, accommodation, and more.

author: JD Pooley
title: 50 years later, local ecosystem still benefiting from Endangered Species Act
text: OAK HARBOR, Ohio (WTVG) - Protecting fish, wildlife, and plants was the goal of the Endangered Species Act. Now, 50 years later, Jason Lewis, refuge manager at Ottawa National Wildlife Refuge in Oak Harbor said the legislation passed in 1973 has had lasting effects protecting the local ecosystem here in Northwest Ohio.â€œIn the 60s when we started having DDT (Dichlorodiphenyltrichloroethane) and other pesticides started having impacts on our species across the country. And in that 50 years weâ€™ve had nearly 17,000 species that have been protected,â€ Lewis said. â€œIt also provided as recovery responsibility; recovery actions have to be taken.â€Lewis added that those actions can be seen today with the bald eagle population in Northwest Ohio.â€œ1979 we had four nesting pairs in the whole state of Ohio, four nesting pairs, you fast forward to 2020, we had over 700 nesting pairs statewide,â€ Lewis said.The Ottawa National Wildlife Refuge plays host to 11,000 acres of land. Within that, there are over 200 species of birds including anywhere from 16-20 nesting pairs of bald eagles. In 2007, the bald eagle was delisted as an endangered species.Lewis added that itâ€™s not just birds that have been protected since 1973. Plants have benefitted as well.â€œHere locally we have the Eastern Prairie Fringed Orchid, Ottawa has, our high count here is over 2,000 Plants, so weâ€™re one of the last remaining strongholds in the whole state of Ohio,â€ Lewis said. See a spelling or grammar error in our story? Please include the title when you click here to report it. Copyright 2024 WTVG. All rights reserved.

organizations.name: ottawa national wildlife refuge in oak harbor

author: PA News Agency
title: Sharp rise in religious hate crimes recorded by UKâ€™s largest police forces | Daily Echo
text:
The number of antisemitic hate crimes recorded by many of the UKâ€™s largest police forces jumped sharply in the weeks following the outbreak of the Hamas-Israel conflict, new figures reveal.
Islamophobic offences also rose for some forces, although the picture was more mixed across the country.
Jewish charities called the findings â€œshockingâ€, while campaigners against anti-Muslim abuse said the data was â€œdeeply worryingâ€.
The Home Office condemned the rise in offences, adding: â€œThere is no place for hate in our society.â€
(PA Graphics) The figures have been obtained by the PA news agency using Freedom of Information requests. They show that:
â€“ Greater Manchester Police recorded 74 antisemitic offences in the month following the Hamas attacks on Israel on October 7, compared with 15 for the same period in 2022 and 14 in 2021, while West Yorkshire Police recorded 53, compared with 10 (2022) and 14 (2021).
â€“ West Midlands Police recorded 22 antisemitic offences from October 7 to November 7, compared with one (2022) and eight (2021), while Merseyside Police recorded 20 compared with four (both 2022 and 2021).
â€“ The British Transport Police had one of the largest increases, recording 87 antisemitic offences in the month after October 7, up from eight in the same period in 2022 and 11 in 2021, as well as a jump in Islamophobic offences with 22 (2023), up from two (2022) and eight (2021).
â€“ West Yorkshire recorded 49 Islamophobic offences in this period in 2023, up from 29 (2022) and 38 (2021), but the pattern was not so clear for Greater Manchester (34 in 2023, 43 in 2022 and 42 in 2021) or West Midlands (25 in 2023, 33 in 2022 and 23 in 2021).
(PA Graphics) The Community Security Trust described the figures as â€œshockingâ€ and said they made clear â€œthe extent of the unacceptable rise in anti-Jewish hatred across the country since the Hamas terror attack on October 7â€.
A spokesman for the Jewish charity said: â€œThis wave of antisemitism was triggered by the mass murder, rape and kidnapping of Jews in Israel, and is fuelled and sustained by extremist hatred online and on our streets.
â€œIt is essential that perpetrators are identified and prosecuted, and that wider society shows its disgust for this racist hate crime.â€
Tell Mama, which monitors and works to tackle anti-Muslim sentiment and abuse in the UK, told PA that â€œlevels of anti-Muslim hatred and discrimination are deeply worrying, impacting trust in authorities and their sense of identity and belongingâ€.
Iman Atta, the organisationâ€™s director, said there had been a â€œsignificant spike in anti-Muslim hate since the atrocities on October 7â€, adding: â€œThe nature of many offline cases sent to our service is often overtly racist â€“ targeting Arab and Palestinian communities with dehumanising slurs, anti-Muslim slurs or in some cases targeting their homes, or when speaking Arabic in public, as well as targeting Muslim communities across all ages and gender.
â€œWe should never allow such hatred and intolerance to take root in our communities and at this time, please look out for each other, whether Muslim or Jewish. We must stand together against intolerance, hate and racism.â€
The Metropolitan Police, the largest force in the UK, said delays prevented it from supplying full figures until the new year, but it had previously reported 218 antisemitic and 101 Islamophobic offences between October 1 and 18 this year, compared with 15 and 42 respectively in the same period in 2022.
PA obtained full responses from 31 of the 46 forces across the UK, with the data representing a snapshot of what has currently been recorded by forces and is therefore subject to change.
Methods for recording hate crime are not consistent across forces, so the data cannot be used to compare the number of offences between different areas or provide an overall total for the whole of the UK.
But the figures do point to a jump in antisemitic offences recorded by forces concentrated mostly in cities or across built-up areas, while the pattern for Islamophobic offences was more varied.
(PA Graphics) Some forces that operate across a mix of urban and less populated areas tend to show a similar pattern, although with lower volumes of offences â€“ for example Hertfordshire Police (17 antisemitic offences for the period in 2023, compared with six in 2022 and three in 2021) and Thames Valley Police (21 antisemitic offences in 2023, one in 2022 and four in 2021).
Data obtained from smaller forces, or those covering areas with few towns or cities, typically showed low numbers of offences, often in single figures, meaning a clear trend was hard to determine.
A spokesman for the Board of Deputies of British Jews said the findings â€œprovide further evidence of the huge upsurge in antisemitism following the Hamas massacre of October 7â€.
The board, seen as the voice of the British Jewish community with over 300 deputies directly elected by the synagogues and communal organisations they represent, told PA the rise in antisemitism had â€œcaused enormous anxiety for Jewish people, particularly children and Jewish students on campus or indeed anyone easily identified as Jewish by their dressâ€.
A spokesman added: â€œWe call on police to take strong action against anyone found to be perpetrating hate crimes.â€
The Muslim Council of Britain said: â€œDespite the extremely low reporting rate from Muslim communities, the huge increase in Islamophobic hate crimes recorded with the police reflects what we are seeing from third-party reporting groups.
â€œThe Governmentâ€™s laissez-faire attitude to Islamophobia contrasts strongly with its no-tolerance approach to antisemitism. We are hopeful this will now change.â€
A spokesperson for the Home Office said: â€œThere is no place for hate in our society and we condemn the recent rise in reported antisemitic and anti-Muslim hatred.
â€œWe expect the police to fully investigate all hate crimes and work with the CPS to make sure the cowards who commit these abhorrent offences feel the full force of the law.
â€œFollowing recent events, we have also made further funding available to Jewish and Muslim communities, to provide additional security at places of worship and faith schools.â€

organizations.name: pa news agency using freedom of information

author: suzy
title: #14 SÃ¡nchez celebra la salida de Vox de gobiernos autonÃ³micos: "Es un gran dÃ­a para EspaÃ±a"
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
Al final el gobierno frankenstein, el que iba a reventar por un lado u otro, ahÃ­ sigue. Y mientras el PP teniendo que lidiar con una panda de paletos vociferantes como aliados, y ahora ademÃ¡s con una escisiÃ³n aÃºn mÃ¡s paleta y aÃºn mÃ¡s vociferante.
Pues voy a hacer de abogado del diablo. Lo primero de todo es que avisaron de salirse de los gobiernos si se cumplÃ­a lo del reparto de menores...y han cumplido. Seguramente si hubieran reculado ya estarÃ­amos con el mantra de los sillones y las poltronas.
Se estÃ¡ celebrando el reparto, cuando seguimos sin atajar el problema. Muchos de ellos no son menores, no tenemos informaciÃ³n alguna suya previa y por mucho que digamos donde deberÃ­an estar es con sus familias.
Supongo que desde la perspectiva de la "izquierda" esto es una fiesta. Pero no todo el mundo piensa igual y esto es un problema que ni los polÃ­ticos de izquierda o derecha se van a comer en sus barrios y casas.
Luego vendrÃ¡n los sesudos anÃ¡lisis del auge de la ultra derecha.
Y bueno, ahora ya podÃ©is tildarme de fascista o lo que os salga de las pelotas por no seguir el ideario estÃ¡ndar de la izquierda.
Teniendo en cuenta el contexto, que vox es un partido de gente que ha demostrado tener poca capacidad de gestionar, que es un partido para hacer ruido en la oposiciÃ³n mÃ¡s que para gobernar (igual que podemos en este punto), y que esta crisis de los menores no es ni de lejos representativo del problema inmigratorio.
Pero hay que reconocer que esto es un gesto de honestidad que no recordamos en la polÃ­tica espaÃ±ola. Renunciar a poltronas porque se han incumplido puntos que eran importantes para ellos desde el punto de vista de programa. Sobre cualquier otro partido (desde el PP a indepes o el psoe) hay cientos de ejemplos de lo contrario, de aferrarse al sillÃ³n y capear las preguntas con una desvergÃ¼enza acojonante.
Todo por repartirse 300-400 niÃ±os entre 44 millones de espaÃ±oles, niÃ±os que ya estÃ¡n en EspaÃ±a (sÃ­, Canarias, seÃ±or Abascal, es EspaÃ±a y hay que ser solidaria con ella, que tambiÃ©n hay espaÃ±oles allÃ­) y cosa que lleva haciÃ©ndose cada aÃ±o. Ultra"catÃ³licos" negando el auxilio a niÃ±os. VAYA VAYA.
Es que no dan para mÃ¡s. Ni honor ni pollas, es que son tontos. El "honor" es para las batallas, no para la polÃ­tica.
Me arremango el fajÃ­n y apurandome el Cinzano promulgo:
-Hay un movimiento divertido en la derecha, al crecer Vox, el PP se vio obligado a endurecer sus posturas mas escoradas para intentar recuperar los votos del ala mas reaccionaria que se iban desangrando pa Vox, eso es lo que vimos estos aÃ±os, un "a ver quien dice la idiotez mas gorda". Esta semana asistimos a una nueva dinÃ¡mica encabezada por el follaardillas, Vox ha visto como le crece un enano por la derecha, no puede permitirlo, o sea q se enfurruÃ±an y se cierran en banda haciendo bandera de... pos algo tan propagandistico y de impacto entre el electorado mas ultra como los MENAS... (Aunque sea algo tan anecdÃ³tico como 21 personas, muchos niÃ±os, pa acoger en una comunidad como Castilla.... q lo pones en perspectiva y dices q cojones 21 personas no tienes donde meterlas en la espaÃ±a vacia???? Esto no es "problema" esto es publicidad pa sus cafeteros) Con lo que puede ojo puede, que el PP vuelva a intentar pegar un giro hacia el centro (con el debilitamiento del ala dura del partido, Ayuso juapa, te miro a ti q ultimamente estas muy callada) y dejar que Vox y Alvise se maten a garrotazos a ver quien es mas y muy EjpaÃ±Ã³
Golpe en la barra erupto, niÃ±o ponte una tapita aqui anda, que hay que darle culto al cuerpo

author: Ashly Caceres
title: MÃ©xico confirma segundo caso humano de miasis por gusano barrenador: resurgen contagios en Chiapas
text:
MÃ©xico confirma segundo caso humano de miasis por gusano barrenador: resurgen contagios en Chiapas
Un hombre en Chiapas presenta el segundo caso confirmado en humanos por miasis, una infecciÃ³n provocada por el gusano barrenador.
MÃ©xico vuelve a encender las alertas sanitarias tras confirmarse el segundo caso humano de miasis por gusano barrenador. El paciente, un hombre de 50 aÃ±os residente de TuzantlÃ¡n, Chiapas, fue diagnosticado tras presentar una infecciÃ³n cutÃ¡nea severa dÃ­as despuÃ©s de sufrir una mordedura de perro. La SecretarÃ­a de Salud federal activÃ³ protocolos de vigilancia epidemiolÃ³gica para evitar la propagaciÃ³n de esta enfermedad parasitaria, que hasta hace poco se creÃ­a erradicada del paÃ­s.
El gusano barrenador, conocido cientÃ­ficamente como Cochliomyia hominivorax, provoca miasis al depositar sus larvas en heridas abiertas, donde estas se alimentan del tejido vivo. Aunque la infecciÃ³n afecta comÃºnmente al ganado, su transmisiÃ³n a humanos representa un riesgo emergente, especialmente en zonas rurales y con alta exposiciÃ³n al contacto animal.
PUEDES VER:
[â€˜Ya tienes precioâ€™: diputada Ealy recibe amenaza de muerte por denunciar impunidad en caso Blancoâ€]
Miasis en MÃ©xico: resurge una amenaza olvidada
El regreso de la miasis humana en MÃ©xico representa un retroceso en materia de salud pÃºblica, pues el paÃ­s fue declarado libre del gusano barrenador en 1991. Sin embargo, en los Ãºltimos dos aÃ±os, la OrganizaciÃ³n Mundial de Sanidad Animal (OMSA) reportÃ³ brotes en PanamÃ¡, Costa Rica, Nicaragua y el sur mexicano. El primer caso en humanos en MÃ©xico se registrÃ³ en octubre de 2023, tambiÃ©n en Chiapas. Con esta nueva confirmaciÃ³n, la preocupaciÃ³n sobre un resurgimiento sostenido cobra fuerza.
La mosca del gusano barrenador tiene la capacidad de reproducirse rÃ¡pidamente en climas cÃ¡lidos y hÃºmedos. Sus larvas, una vez depositadas en heridas, generan inflamaciÃ³n, fiebre, dolor intenso y secreciones purulentas. Si no se detectan a tiempo, las consecuencias pueden escalar hasta la necrosis tisular o infecciones sistÃ©micas. En el caso reciente, el paciente recibiÃ³ atenciÃ³n mÃ©dica oportuna y permanece en tratamiento con evoluciÃ³n favorable.
PUEDES VER:
[Confirman el primer caso humano de miasis por gusano barredor en MÃ©xico: Â¿CuÃ¡les son los sÃ­ntomas?]
Zonas afectadas y respuesta sanitaria
Los estados con mayor nÃºmero de reportes por infestaciÃ³n en animales son Chiapas, Tabasco, Campeche y Quintana Roo, donde se han confirmado al menos 369 focos activos desde mediados de 2023. La SecretarÃ­a de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural (SADER) mantiene un programa permanente de vigilancia sanitaria en el ganado, mediante inspecciones y tratamiento de lesiones sospechosas.
A nivel local, autoridades de salud en Chiapas desplegaron brigadas mÃ©dicas para informar a las comunidades sobre los sÃ­ntomas de la miasis y reforzar medidas de higiene. TambiÃ©n se instÃ³ a los veterinarios y mÃ©dicos rurales a notificar inmediatamente cualquier caso sospechoso, tanto en humanos como en animales. La coordinaciÃ³n entre instituciones federales y estatales busca evitar una propagaciÃ³n que afecte tanto a la salud pÃºblica como a la economÃ­a agrÃ­cola.
PUEDES VER:
[William Levy tras su arresto en Florida: ''Voy a demandar a todos los medios que estÃ¡n difundiendo mentiras sobre mÃ­'']
PrevenciÃ³n y riesgos de la miasis por gusano barrenador
Prevenir la miasis por gusano barrenador en humanos requiere atenciÃ³n a heridas, higiene constante y control de vectores. Las autoridades recomiendan lavar y cubrir adecuadamente cualquier lesiÃ³n, evitar el contacto directo con animales callejeros y acudir al mÃ©dico ante cualquier signo de infecciÃ³n. Aunque la miasis es una enfermedad controlable, su negligencia puede poner en riesgo la vida, especialmente en comunidades con acceso limitado a servicios mÃ©dicos.

author: Guest
title: Video: Lava fountains soar to 215 700 feet in Hawaii
text:
Video: Lava fountains soar to 215 700 feet in Hawaii
Lava fountains reached 700 feet at KÄ«lauea volcano on Tuesday during episode 16 of the ongoing HalemaÊ»umaÊ»u eruption. The volcano entered a phase of intense lava fountaining about 12 hours after the episode started. Lava shot up from the southern vent, hitting over 200 feet and surpassed 700 feet later in the day.

author: Yaffee
title: Rep. Aderholt wants government agencies to publicly post how many employees come to work in-person
text:
U.S. Rep. Robert Aderholt (R-Haleyville) is scrutinizing federal government agencies in Washington D.C. for allowing too many of their employees to work from home instead of showing up to the office.
â€œAmericans across the nation show up to work, in-person, every day while federal employees are consistently abusing work-from-home policies within their respective agencies,â€ Aderholt told Yellowhammer News Thursday. â€œAgencies with direct service to the public, like the Social Security Administration, are some of the biggest perpetrators of this abuse of the system. Some of these employees are even living in other states, while still receiving D.C. locality pay.â€
In response to the problem, House Republicans are planning to
direct agencies to publicly post how many employees come to work in person in Washington.
RELATED:
Gary Palmer wants federal employees to get back to work
Aderholt, who chairs the House Appropriations Subcommittee on Labor, Health and Human Services, and Education, believes this is needed because itâ€™s past time for these employees to â€œreturn to work.â€
â€œFederal agencies that provide direct service to the public must return to work to better serve the American people,â€ he said. â€œTelework should be judged solely on a case-by-case basis, not blanket policies.â€
The directive would be a part of the would be included in the committee report that accompanies the Labor, Health and Human Services, and Education appropriations bill.
â€œThe American people deserve a federal workforce that reflects the reality of showing up to work every day,: Aderholt added. â€œThis is why abuse of telework across the federal government must end. I urge the Secretaries of these agencies to bring federal employees back to the workplace immediately so that the American people can be served in a way they deserve. Simply put, itâ€™s time to get back to work. The rest of the country has, and itâ€™s past time for our federal employees to do the same.â€
The directive also includes an accounting of Education Department and Health and Human Services employees who receive Washington-area locality pay, but donâ€™t frequently work in office.
Yaffee is a contributing writer to Yellowhammer News and hosts â€œThe Yaffee Programâ€ weekdays 9-11 a.m. on
WVNN. You can follow him on X @Yaffee

author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: EPA Employee Monitoring Intensifies with Badge and AI Tracking | Technology
text:
EPA Employee Monitoring Intensifies with Badge and AI Tracking
The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is increasing monitoring of its employees through badge tracking, AI, and data analysis to ensure compliance with in-office work directives. This move aligns with the Trump administration's technological initiatives for government efficiency, sparking concerns about privacy and professional autonomy.
The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is implementing new measures to monitor employee presence at the office, including tracking badge swipes, laptop logins, and additional data metrics. The initiative comes as the Trump administration continues to focus on technological solutions to enhance government operations.
An internal memo, revealed this week, indicates that employees are expected to comply with in-office directives or face potential disciplinary actions, including termination. This follows the rescission of remote-work agreements on February 12. AI applications for monitoring were referenced, but the EPA clarified it is not using these technologies for direct personnel decisions.
While the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has not adopted similar tracking measures, the EPA's actions reflect a broader trend of monitoring under Elon Musk's influence, according to sources. As debates continue over privacy and employment rights, the question of how technology and government employee relations will coexist remains at the forefront.
(With inputs from agencies.)
